response.raw_message_text:
{
  "risk_factors": [
    ["Age (21)", "medium", "Young age is associated with higher risk, though early adulthood also presents opportunities for rehabilitation."],
    ["Gender (Male)", "medium", "Males statistically have higher recidivism rates, increasing the risk moderately."],
    ["Race (White)", "low", "Race is less determinative in recidivism predictions; being White does not significantly elevate risk."],
    ["Criminal history (4 arrests and convictions)", "high", "A considerable number of arrests and convictions strongly predict higher risk of recidivism."],
    ["Substance use (marijuana and cocaine)", "high", "Recent substance use is a significant risk factor for recidivism."],
    ["Mental health (periods of severe depression)", "high", "Experiencing depression can impair judgment and increase risk, contributing significantly to recidivism."],
    ["Living arrangement (living alone)", "medium", "Living alone can reduce social support, slightly raising recidivism risk."],
    ["Marital status (never married)", "low", "Being unmarried slightly influences risk, but is less predictive than other factors."],
    ["Education (high school diploma and enrolled in college)", "low", "Educational engagement is generally a protective factor against recidivism."],
    ["Employment history (held 3 jobs during the year)", "medium", "Frequent job changes may indicate instability, potentially increasing recidivism risk."],
    ["Family background (lived with both biological parents in an urban area)", "medium", "Urban upbringing can expose individuals to higher risk environments, though a stable family setting offers some protection."],
    ["Religious belief (considers God influential)", "low", "Religious beliefs may provide personal stability and a protective effect against recidivism."]
  ],
  "prediction": "YES",
  "confidence": 75
}

risk_factors: Young age is associated with higher risk, though early adulthood also presents opportunities for rehabilitation.
Males statistically have higher recidivism rates, increasing the risk moderately.
Race is less determinative in recidivism predictions; being White does not significantly elevate risk.
A considerable number of arrests and convictions strongly predict higher risk of recidivism.
Recent substance use is a significant risk factor for recidivism.
Experiencing depression can impair judgment and increase risk, contributing significantly to recidivism.
Living alone can reduce social support, slightly raising recidivism risk.
Being unmarried slightly influences risk, but is less predictive than other factors.
Education (high school diploma and enrolled in college)
Educational engagement is generally a protective factor against recidivism.
Employment history (held 3 jobs during the year)
Frequent job changes may indicate instability, potentially increasing recidivism risk.
Family background (lived with both biological parents in an urban area)
Urban upbringing can expose individuals to higher risk environments, though a stable family setting offers some protection.
Religious beliefs may provide personal stability and a protective effect against recidivism.

prompt.system:
You are a highly experienced criminal justice risk assessment expert
employing advanced statistical and judicial knowledge.
prompt.user:
You are a criminal risk assessment expert. Step back, take a deep breath and carefully think step by step to assign a relative weight [low, medium, high] to each risk factor before using them to collectively predict 3-year rearrest recidivism:
The person is a 21-year-old male who identifies himself as White. He has been arrested 4 times and has been convicted. He is 5 feet 7 inches and weighs 165 lbs. He has never been married and is currently living alone. He has a high school diploma and is enrolled in a 4-year college. He has held 3 jobs during the year. He has used drugs in the past four years (marijuana and cocaine) and some of the time during the past month he has felt so down in the dumps that nothing could cheer him up. At a young age, he lived with both of his biological parents in a household of size 5, in an urban area. He considers that God has something to do with what happens to him personally.

After your analysis, you must respond ONLY with a JSON object in exactly this format, with no additional text:

{
  "risk_factors": [
    ("factor1", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ("factor2", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ...
  ],
  "prediction": "YES" or "NO",
  "confidence": number between 0 and 100
}
